result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamaine S. Hayden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jamaine S. Hayden is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jamaine S. Hayden was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*   Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days - PD Greg Bates.

Minutes:  14CF264/14CF580/14CF825.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Bates.  Cases are resolved.

14CF264 - deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Count 2 is dismissed on State's motion.

14CF580 - deft pleads guilty to counts 1 & 2; found guilty by the Court.  Count 3 is dismissed on State's motion.

14CF825 - deft pleads guilty to counts 1 & 2; found guilty by the Court.  Count 3 is dismissed on State's motion.

Parties waive PSI.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for two years on each count.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgments.  Bond shall be applied towards financial obligations.  Balance, if any, may be returned to poster.
